content.description:
Begin with a low start left of

Golgotha

, and move up on superb crimps. Take it slow, and juggle some topout holds!
content.location: Find the boulder positioned on the entrance to Jerusalem. It is the first route as you walk by.

content.description:
This is the left-facing dihedral on the far right side of the crag and right of the other climbs. It starts out very easy getting to the dihedral which contains a thin crack. The crack is fun and you may use some face holds shared with

Ezekiel

. After the small roof near the top, the climb joins the

Ezekiel

crack to the left for the final few moves.
content.protection: A standard rack up to a #2 Camalot with lots of small (finger-sized) cams. Anchor to a tree at the top.
content.location:
The climb goes up the left-facing dihedral on the right side of the crag. It is to the right of

Ezekiel

. The first moves are easy and covered with much debris.

content.description:
Climb the arete all the way to the top. From the ground, start out on some easy moves climbing about 8 feet before getting some good gear in a seam. Continue on the easy moves placing gear where it’s presented until you gain the unique dihedral arete feature. Enjoy the exposure, and take it to the top! There is great gear for the entirety, and this is a really fun 5.7.

Once reaching the ledge at the top, you can scramble on the left to reach a tree. It is best to bring your follower up.
content.location: Start on the bottom left edge of Jerusalem roughly following the arete all the way to the top.

content.description:
“‘Woe to him who piles up stolen goods and makes himself wealthy by extortion!"

Start just to the left of

Ezekiel

. Habakkuk is the left of the two crack lines going up through the center of the face.

Climb up easy terrain placing pro where you get it until you reach the ledge. Step up, place a high piece in the crack, and make a couple moves to a rest and the upper section of the climb. The top moves are the best, so enjoy!

Once reaching the ledge at the top, you can scramble on the left to reach a tree. It is best to bring your follower up.
content.protection: A single rack to #2 and small gear for the crux.
content.location:
It is just right of

Jeremiah

.

content.description: Start low in the center of the face, and go straight up on crimps and jugs to the top.
content.location: On the trail just before arriving at Jerusalem.

content.description:
"I will take your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh."

Climb easy but steep, juggy terrain up to a small ledge. Proceed through a couple of cracks up the face and past a mini-roof and then up a shallow corner to the top. Decent gear for the first half leads to some bomber placements for the entire second half.

Once reaching the ledge at the top, you can scramble on the left to reach a tree. It is best to bring your follower up.
content.location:
Just right of

Habakkuk

, Ezekiel is the obvious, double crack feature going through the small overhang.
